intro: Mesembryanthemum oxysepalum, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or physalis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that are encased in a papery calyx, resembling a lantern. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Mesembryanthemum oxysepalum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking appearance and resilience.
